title.narrative: The Biodiversity Finance Initiative (BIOFIN) II - South Africa

description.narrative: The Biodiversity Finance Initiative (BIOFIN) Phase II aims to produce improved biodiversity and development outcomes and to contribute to filling the finance gap through the implementation of Biodiversity Finance Solutions.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: - Number of new and improved finance mechanisms in place and/or operational with increased finance aligned towards biodiversity - Number of policy proposals influenced by new data on biodiversity finance, economic valuation and natural capital accounting - Amount of funds catalyzed through the implementation of finance mechanisms (mobilized, realigned, delivered more effectively, and/or through cost avoidance); - Number of government officials and experts with enhanced skills to design, implement and advocate for biodiversity finance solutions (disaggregated by gender)

comment.narrative: 1. Finance Solution 1: Growing protected area own revenue • Unpack and develop a suite of income generating activities and apply to each conservation MA • Establish the protected area financing forum 2. Finance solution 2: Reform of property rates legislation, interpretation and application to protected areas • Develop a national framework for municipal property rates policies • Consultation with municipalities 3. Finance Solution 3: Building a grant mechanism to adequately finance the biodiversity stewardship programmes • Develop a value proposition for stewardship for consultation with other government departments • Develop a costing and grant framework for stewardship • Stakeholder Consultation 4. Finance Solution 4: Institutional support for biodiversity tax incentives • Technical investigations and technical structuring finalised. • National Treasury’s agreement to amend the Income Tax Act regarding section 37C • Submission of Section 37C • Amendment placed into legislation • National Biodiversity Tax Advisory Committee review • SARS tax return validation processes 5. Finance Solution 5: Improved biodiversity offset modality for protected area expansion • Capture lessons from previous biodiversity offsets consolidated in PAs • Develop guideline for setting conditions of authorisation for Offsets • Train government staff in effective biodiversity offset condition-setting as part of the EA process • Ensure effective offset triggers and guidance in relevant IEM tools, EMPrs, standards & Screening • Extend current offsets register • Interrogate appropriate financial mechanisms to guarantee offset payment • ID key offset receiving areas for potential offset banks and assess specific properties • Assess specific properties to determine whether they could be contractually incorporated or bought for the offset banks • Undertake preliminary work to prepare for declaration & management plan development • Market offset sites to various developers • Conclude agreements between offset banks and liability holders 6. Finance Solution 6: Development and implementation of a voluntary market-based certification scheme in the wildlife sector • Develop a spatial database of game ranches • Undertake assessment of the biodiversity contributions of the ranching sector • Develop a business case for the benefits associated with certification • Develop a demand study • Design of certification system • Stakeholder consultation • Pilot certification system • Development Biodiversity Economy/Certification brand 7. Finance solution 7: Developing and promoting an online biodiversity economy investment portal Land reform and biodiversity stewardship learning exchange • Hold concept workshops to finalise the content & functionality of the platform • Finalise list of priority sites • Prepare an initial overview of the investor landscape • Development of business plans for 10 selected sites • Ongoing capacity building of potential investees • Development of the platform • Develop detailed investor landscape analysis • Develop and implement investor engagement strategy • M&E of investment portal 8. Finance Solution 8: Improve effectiveness of permits • Baseline assessment of provincial income and expenditure from license and permit processes • Review the fees model and recommend a model for determining fees • Develop a guideline for determining fees and amending fees

1. Finance Solution 1: Growing protected area own revenue • Protected area financing forum established and activities identified 2. Finance solution 2: Reform of property rates legislation, interpretation and application to protected areas • Consultation with municipalities completed 3. Finance Solution 3: Building a grant mechanism to adequately finance the biodiversity stewardship programmes • Costing framework developed in consultation with relevant departments and stakeholders 4. Finance Solution 4: Institutional support for biodiversity tax incentives • Technical investigations and technical structuring finalised. • Draft Amendment completed and setting up of a Tax Review Committee 5. Finance Solution 5: Improved biodiversity offset modality for protected area expansion • Offset register developed and receiving environment assessed. • Appropriate financial mechanisms to guarantee offset payment developed 6. Finance Solution 6: Development and implementation of a voluntary market-based certification scheme in the wildlife sector • Certification system developed in consultation with stakeholders and piloted 7. Finance Solution 7 Developing and promoting an online biodiversity investment portal • Development of business plans for 10 selected sites and capacity building 8. Finance Solution 8: Improve effectiveness of permits • Review of the fees model and recommendations of new model for determining fees completed

1. Finance Solution 1: Growing protected area own revenue and retention in four provinces • Convene task teams for each Management Authority (MA) • Complete financial score card (FSC) • Unpack and develop a suite of income generating activities and apply to each conservation MA. 2. Financial solution 2: Reform of property rates legislation, interpretation and application to protected areas. • Technical assessment • Development of a National Treasury budget memo 3. Finance Solution 3: Building a grant mechanism to adequately finance the biodiversity stewardship programmes. • Review of existing grants to identify stewardship funding activities. • Develop a value proposition for stewardship for consultation with other government departments. 4. Finance Solution 4: Institutional support for biodiversity tax incentives • Technical investigations and technical structuring finalised. • National Treasury’s agreement to amend the Income Tax Act regarding section 37C. 5. Finance Solution 5: Improved biodiversity offset modality for protected area expansion. • Capture lessons from previous biodiversity offsets consolidated in PAs. • Develop guideline for setting conditions of authorisation for offsets. • Train government staff in effective biodiversity offset condition-setting as part of the EA process. • Ensure effective offset triggers and guidance in relevant IEM tools, EMPrs, standards & screening. • Extend current offsets register. 6. Finance Solution 6: Development and implementation of a voluntary market-based certification scheme in the wildlife sector • Develop a spatial database of game ranches. • Undertake assessment of the biodiversity contributions of the ranching sector. • Develop a business case for the benefits associated with certification. • Develop a demand study. 7. Finance solution 7: Developing and promoting an online biodiversity economy investment portal. • Land reform and biodiversity stewardship learning exchange. • Hold concept workshops to finalise the content & functionality of the platform. • Finalise list of priority sites. • Prepare an initial overview of the investor landscape. 8. Finance Solution 8: Improve effectiveness of permits. • Baseline assessment of provincial income and expenditure from license and permit processes • Review the fees model and recommend a model for determining fees.

1. Finance Solution 1: Growing protected area own revenue and retention in four provinces • Task teams for each Management Authority (MA) established • Financial score card (FSC)
2. Finance solution 2: Reform of property rates legislation, interpretation and application to protected areas • Technical assessment completed • National Treasury budget memo completed 3. Finance Solution 3: Building a grant mechanism to adequately finance the biodiversity stewardship programmes • Review of existing grants to identify stewardship funding activities completed • Value proposition for stewardship completed 4. Finance Solution 4: Institutional support for biodiversity tax incentives • Technical investigation completed • Submission of Section 37C done to National Treasury 5. Finance Solution 5: Improved biodiversity offset modality for protected area expansion • 1.Lessons on previous offsets captured. • Training of staff done 6. Finance Solution 6: Development and implementation of a voluntary market-based certification scheme in the wildlife sector • Spatial database of game ranches complete • Assessment of biodiversity contribution completed 7. Finance solution 7: Developing and promoting an online biodiversity economy investment portal • 2. Learning exchange done on land reform • Concept workshops completed Finalise list of priority sites • Investor landscape overview completed 8. Finance Solution 8: Improve effectiveness of permits • Baseline assessment of income and expenditure on fees completed

- The BIOFIN Phase II Country Implementation Strategy along with the Country Work Plan is developed and approved by the Steering Committee - The Country Prioritized Finance Solutions are developed and the the implementation phase started • Complete country implementation strategy for Phase II
• Draft Country Implementation Strategy was completed and subjected to intensive stakeholder consultation to finalise finance solutions to be implemented.
